text:
The poet T.S. Eliot wrote

Words strain, 
Crack and sometimes break, under the burden, 
Under the tension, slip, slide, perish, 
Decay with imprecision, will not stay in place, 
Will not stay still. 
â€”Burnt Norton, 1935
You may have had the confusing experience of listening to someone whose words would not 'stay in place'. This means their words come to have different meanings over time.

A dishonest person can confuse others by deliberately using the same term or phrase in different ways. It's even possible to confuse yourself by using the same word or phrase in different ways without realizing it.
When we use the same word in different ways in the context of an argument, this is called the fallacy of equivocation.
